Turning the script into a real parser

Once we are satisified with the functionality of a prototype and we decide to continue further, it will become more and more inconvenient to keep code in a form of a playground script. It is a good practice to define a parser as a class, it allows us to:

  • manage cyclic dependencies,
  • simplify testing and
  • easily extend with new functionality.
